Bash(/Users/ufvg/tradeanim/examples/data/_generate_sample.py << 'PYEOF'
"""
Generate realistic BTC/USD-like daily OHLC data with 80 rows.

The data is constructed in phases to produce interesting visual patterns:
  1. Uptrend        \(days 1-15\)   -- steady climb
  2. Consolidation  \(days 16-25\)  -- sideways chop
  3. Sharp rally    \(days 26-35\)  -- momentum breakout
  4. Reversal / drop\(days 36-50\)  -- sell-off
  5. Accumulation   \(days 51-62\)  -- tight range
  6. Recovery rally  \(days 63-80\) -- gradual recovery
"""

import csv
import random
from datetime import date, timedelta

random.seed\(42\)

START_DATE = date\(2024, 1, 1\)
NUM_ROWS = 80
START_PRICE = 42_000.0

# Phase definitions: \(start_day, end_day, daily_drift%, daily_vol%, description\)
phases = [
    \(0,  14,  0.0060,  0.012,  "uptrend"\),
    \(15, 24,  0.0005,  0.007,  "consolidation"\),
    \(25, 34,  0.0110,  0.015,  "sharp rally"\),
    \(35, 49, -0.0085,  0.018,  "reversal / drop"\),
    \(50, 61,  0.0003,  0.006,  "accumulation"\),
    \(62, 79,  0.0055,  0.013,  "recovery"\),
]


def get_phase_params\(day_index\):
    for start, end, drift, vol, _ in phases:
        if start <= day_index <= end:
            return drift, vol
    return 0.0, 0.012


rows = []
close = START_PRICE

for i in range\(NUM_ROWS\):
    current_date = START_DATE + timedelta\(days=i\)
    drift, vol = get_phase_params\(i\)

    # Random daily return \(log-normal style\)
    daily_return = drift + vol * random.gauss\(0, 1\)

    # Occasionally inject a larger move for realism \(gap days\)
    if random.random\(\) < 0.08:
        daily_return += random.choice\([-1, 1]\) * random.uniform\(0.015, 0.03\)

    open_price = close  # open at previous close

    # Intraday high/low spread -- wider on volatile days
    intraday_range = abs\(daily_return\) + random.uniform\(0.005, 0.015\)
    mid_move = open_price * \(1 + daily_return\)

    # Build high and low around the move
    high_extension = random.uniform\(0.3, 0.7\) * intraday_range
    low_extension = random.uniform\(0.3, 0.7\) * intraday_range

    if daily_return >= 0:
        high_price = mid_move * \(1 + high_extension\)
        low_price = open_price * \(1 - low_extension\)
    else:
        high_price = open_price * \(1 + high_extension\)
        low_price = mid_move * \(1 - low_extension\)

    close_price = mid_move

    # Ensure OHLC consistency: high >= max\(open,close\), low <= min\(open,close\)
    high_price = max\(high_price, open_price, close_price\)
    low_price = min\(low_price, open_price, close_price\)

    # Volume: base volume with some randomness; higher on big-move days
    base_volume = 28_000
    vol_multiplier = 1.0 + 3.0 * abs\(daily_return\)
    volume = base_volume * vol_multiplier * random.uniform\(0.7, 1.4\)

    rows.append\({
        "date": current_date.isoformat\(\),
        "open": round\(open_price, 2\),
        "high": round\(high_price, 2\),
        "low": round\(low_price, 2\),
        "close": round\(close_price, 2\),
        "volume": round\(volume, 1\),
    }\)

    close = close_price  # carry forward

# Write CSV
output_path = "/Users/ufvg/tradeanim/examples/data/sample_ohlc.csv"
with open\(output_path, "w", newline=""\) as f:
    writer = csv.DictWriter\(f, fieldnames=["date", "open", "high", "low", "close", "volume"]\)
    writer.writeheader\(\)
    writer.writerows\(rows\)

# Print summary
print\(f"Wrote {len\(rows\)} rows to {output_path}"\)
print\(f"Date range : {rows[0]['date']} -> {rows[-1]['date']}"\)
print\(f"Price range: {min\(r['low'] for r in rows\):.2f} -> {max\(r['high'] for r in rows\):.2f}"\)
print\(f"Start close: {rows[0]['close']:.2f}"\)
print\(f"End close  : {rows[-1]['close']:.2f}"\)
print\(\)

# Show phase boundaries
for start, end, drift, vol, desc in phases:
    s_close = rows[start]["close"]
    e_close = rows[end]["close"]
    pct = \(e_close - s_close\) / s_close * 100
    print\(f"  Days {start:>2}-{end:>2}  {desc:<22}  {s_close:>10.2f} -> {e_close:>10.2f}  \({pct:+.1f}%\)"\)
PYEOF)

Bash(/Users/ufvg/tradeanim/docs/index.html << 'EOF'

# Core Concepts

Scene

The Scene is the main entry point. Subclass it and override construct\(\) to build your animation timeline. 

pythonclass Scene:
    def __init__\(self, config: Optional[RenderConfig] = None, **kwargs\)

Key Methods

Method Return Description
load_chart\(csv_path, **kwargs\) Chart Load OHLC data from CSV
play\(*animations, duration=None, delay=0.0\) — Schedule animations; advances timeline
play_with_previous\(*animations, duration=None, offset=0.0\) — Overlap with previous play\(\) call; does not advance timeline
wait\(duration=1.0\) — Pause / advance timeline
add_element\(element\) — Manually add an element to the scene
remove_element\(element\) — Manually remove an element from the scene
render\(output_path="output.mp4"\) — Build and render to video

Properties

Property Type Description
total_duration float Total timeline length in seconds
visible_elements list Elements where visible=True and opacity > 0
camera Camera The Camera instance
chart Chart | None The loaded Chart \(or None\)

Example showing play_with_previous for overlapping animations:

pythonclass OverlapDemo\(Scene\):
    def construct\(self\):
        chart = self.load_chart\("data.csv"\)
        title = Title\("My Chart"\)

        self.play\(FadeIn\(title\), duration=0.5\)
        self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart\), duration=4\)
        # Fade out title while candles are still appearing
        self.play_with_previous\(FadeOut\(title\), duration=0.8, offset=2.0\)
        self.wait\(1\)

Camera

Controls the viewport — which candles and price range are visible.

Fields

Field Type Default Description
view_start float 0.0 Left edge of viewport \(candle index\)
view_end float 50.0 Right edge of viewport
price_min float 0.0 Bottom of price axis
price_max float 100.0 Top of price axis

Methods

Method Description
fit_to_candles\(candles, padding_top=0.05, padding_bottom=0.05, padding_right=3\) Auto-adjusts viewport to fit visible candles
Note: The camera is automatically managed by CandlesAppear and ZoomTo animations when auto_camera=True \(default\). You rarely need to set camera values manually.

Animation Base Class

All animations extend the Animation base class. 

pythonclass Animation:
    def __init__\(self, duration=1.0, easing=None\)

Override Points

Method Description
on_start\(scene\) Called once when animation begins
on_update\(scene, progress\) Called every frame with eased progress \(0.0 to 1.0\)
on_finish\(scene\) Called once when animation completes

Default easing is ease_out_cubic for smooth deceleration.

Example custom animation:

pythonfrom tradeanim import Animation
from tradeanim.easing import ease_in_out_sine

class PulseOpacity\(Animation\):
    def __init__\(self, element, min_val=0.3, max_val=1.0\):
        super\(\).__init__\(duration=2.0, easing=ease_in_out_sine\)
        self.element = element
        self.min_val = min_val
        self.max_val = max_val

    def on_update\(self, scene, progress\):
        import math
        t = math.sin\(progress * math.pi * 2\)
        self.element.opacity = self.min_val + \(self.max_val - self.min_val\) * \(t * 0.5 + 0.5\)

Timeline System

The timeline is built by three methods that control when animations start and how the current time advances:

  • play\(\) — schedules animations at the current time and advances the timeline by their duration.
  • play_with_previous\(\) — schedules at the previous play\(\) start time + offset; does not advance the timeline.
  • wait\(\) — advances the timeline without any animation.
  • delay parameter in play\(\) — staggers multiple animations within the same call.
textTimeline:
0s          1s          2s          3s          4s
|-- play\(A, duration=2\) --|
            |-- play\(B, duration=2\) --|
                    |-- play_with_previous\(C, offset=1\) --|
                                      |-- wait\(1\) --|
Tip: Think of play\(\) as “do this next” and play_with_previous\(\) as “do this at the same time as the last thing.” The offset parameter lets you fine-tune exactly when the overlap begins.
EOF)

Bash(/Users/ufvg/tradeanim/docs/index.html << 'ENDSECTION'

# Configuration

RenderConfig

Controls video output and visual settings. Pass options directly to the Scene constructor as keyword arguments.

Parameter Type Default Description
Video
width int 1920 Output video width in pixels
height int 1080 Output video height in pixels
fps int 60 Frames per second
dpi int 100 Matplotlib DPI
codec str "libx264" FFmpeg video codec
pixel_format str "yuv420p" FFmpeg pixel format
crf int 18 Constant Rate Factor \(0=lossless, 51=worst\)
preset str "medium" FFmpeg encoding speed preset
Visuals
theme Theme Theme\(\) Color theme \(see Themes below\)
font_family str "monospace" Default font family
candle_width float 0.6 Candle body width
candle_spacing float 1.0 Space between candles
wick_linewidth float 1.2 Wick line thickness
padding_top float 0.05 Camera top padding \(fraction of price range\)
padding_bottom float 0.05 Camera bottom padding
padding_right int 3 Extra candles of space on right
Grid
show_grid bool True Show grid lines
grid_alpha float 0.3 Grid line opacity
grid_linewidth float 0.5 Grid line width
grid_style str "solid" Grid style: "solid", "dashed", "dotted", "dashdot"
grid_axis str "both" Which axes: "both", "x"/"vertical", "y"/"horizontal"
minor_grid bool False Show minor grid lines
minor_grid_alpha float 0.15 Minor grid opacity
minor_grid_linewidth float 0.3 Minor grid line width
Volume
show_volume bool False Show volume subplot below chart
volume_height_ratio float 0.15 Volume panel height as fraction of total
Extras
watermark Optional[str] None Watermark text \(centered, large, faded\)
watermark_alpha float 0.1 Watermark opacity
speed_multiplier float 1.0 Animation speed \(2.0 = twice as fast\)
supersample int 1 Supersampling factor \(2 = render at 2x, LANCZOS downscale\)
background_gradient Optional[tuple] None Background gradient as \(top_color, bottom_color\)
candle_shadow bool False Enable drop shadows on candles
candle_shadow_offset tuple \(0.08, -0.08\) Shadow offset \(x, y\)
candle_shadow_color str "#00000040" Shadow color with alpha
candle_bull_color_override Optional[str] None Override all bull candle colors
candle_bear_color_override Optional[str] None Override all bear candle colors
post_processing Optional[PostProcessConfig] None Post-processing effects \(see PostProcessConfig\) 
pythonscene = MyScene\(
    width=1920, height=1080, fps=30,
    theme=MIDNIGHT_THEME,
    grid_style="dashed",
    grid_axis="horizontal",
    candle_shadow=True,
    show_volume=True,
    watermark="CONFIDENTIAL",
\)
scene.render\("output.mp4"\)

Theme Presets

Six built-in color themes are available as importable constants. Each theme controls background, candle colors, grid, text, and axis styling.

Theme Constant Background Bull Candles Bear Candles Best For
DARK_THEME #131722 Green \(#26a69a\) Red \(#ef5350\) TradingView-style dark charts
LIGHT_THEME #ffffff Green \(#26a69a\) Red \(#ef5350\) Light background presentations
WHITE_THEME #ffffff White body + black border/wick Fully black Classic financial charts
WHITE_GREEN_THEME #ffffff Green \(#81c784\) body + black border/wick Fully black Green/black print style
BLACK_THEME #000000 Bright green \(#11cd83\) Bright red \(#f23645\) High contrast dark charts
MIDNIGHT_THEME #161b1e White Gray \(#636363\) Cinematic monochrome look

Using a built-in theme:

pythonfrom tradeanim import *

class DarkChart\(Scene\):
    def construct\(self\):
        chart = self.load_chart\("data.csv"\)
        self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart\), duration=3\)

DarkChart\(theme=BLACK_THEME\).render\("dark.mp4"\)

Creating a custom theme:

pythonmy_theme = Theme\(
    background="#1a1a2e",
    panel_bg="#16213e",
    bull_body="#00ff88",
    bear_body="#ff4444",
    bull_wick="#00ff88",
    bear_wick="#ff4444",
    grid_color="#1e3a5f",
    text_color="#e0e0e0",
    axis_color="#888888",
\)

MyScene\(theme=my_theme\).render\("custom.mp4"\)

PostProcessConfig

Post-processing effects applied after each frame render. Requires Pillow \(pip install Pillow\).

Parameter Type Default Description
bloom_enabled bool False Enable glow/bloom effect
bloom_radius int 15 Bloom blur radius in pixels
bloom_intensity float 0.15 Bloom blend strength \(0–1\)
vignette_enabled bool False Darken edges of frame
vignette_strength float 0.3 Vignette intensity
color_grading Optional[dict] None Color adjustments dict \(see below\)
chromatic_aberration_enabled bool False RGB channel splitting
chromatic_aberration_offset float 3.0 Pixel shift for R/B channels
lens_distortion_enabled bool False Barrel/pincushion distortion
lens_distortion_k float 0.0 Distortion coefficient \(negative=barrel, positive=pincushion\)
Note: The color_grading dictionary accepts the keys "brightness", "contrast", and "saturation", each as a float where 1.0 is no change. 
pythonpp = PostProcessConfig\(
    bloom_enabled=True,
    bloom_intensity=0.2,
    vignette_enabled=True,
    vignette_strength=0.3,
    chromatic_aberration_enabled=True,
    chromatic_aberration_offset=3.0,
    color_grading={"brightness": 1.05, "contrast": 1.1, "saturation": 1.0},
\)

MyScene\(post_processing=pp\).render\("cinematic.mp4"\)
Tip: Use AnimatePostProcess to smoothly transition post-processing effects during the video.
ENDSECTION)

# Chart Types

Loading Data

Charts are loaded from CSV files with OHLC columns. 

pythonchart = Chart.from_csv\(
    path,                        # Path to CSV file
    chart_type="candlestick",    # "candlestick", "line", "area", "ohlc"
    date_col=None,               # Auto-detects: date, datetime, timestamp, time, dt
    open_col="open",             # Column name for open prices
    high_col="high",             # Column name for high prices
    low_col="low",               # Column name for low prices
    close_col="close",           # Column name for close prices
    volume_col="volume",         # Column name for volume
    start=None,                  # Start row index \(slice data\)
    end=None,                    # End row index \(slice data\)
\)
Note: Column names are case-insensitive — "Open", "OPEN", and "open" all work.

Chart Properties

Property Type Description
chart.candles list[CandleElement] Always available regardless of chart_type
chart.elements list Visual elements for the chosen chart_type
chart.timestamps list[str] Date/time labels
chart.df pd.DataFrame The underlying data
len\(chart\) int Number of candles
chart[i] CandleElement Access candle by index
chart.closes np.ndarray All close prices
chart.opens np.ndarray All open prices
chart.highs np.ndarray All high prices
chart.lows np.ndarray All low prices
chart.volumes np.ndarray All volumes
chart.price_at\(i\) float Close price at index i
chart.high_at\(i\) float High price at index i
chart.low_at\(i\) float Low price at index i
chart.slice\(start, end\) list[CandleElement] Slice of candles

Candlestick \(default\)

Standard OHLC candlestick chart. Each candle is a CandleElement with body and wicks. 

pythonchart = self.load_chart\("data.csv"\)  # chart_type="candlestick" is default
self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart, style="sequential"\), duration=3\)

Line Chart

Close prices connected by a line. 

pythonchart = Chart.from_csv\("data.csv", chart_type="line"\)
self.play\(ChartAppear\(chart\), duration=3\)

Area Chart

Close prices with gradient fill from line to baseline. 

pythonchart = Chart.from_csv\("data.csv", chart_type="area"\)
self.play\(ChartAppear\(chart\), duration=3\)

OHLC Bars

Traditional OHLC bar chart with vertical high-low line and open/close tick marks. 

pythonchart = Chart.from_csv\("data.csv", chart_type="ohlc"\)
self.play\(ChartAppear\(chart\), duration=3\)
Tip: For candlestick charts, use CandlesAppear which supports 6 animation styles. For line/area/ohlc, use ChartAppear which handles opacity and draw_progress automatically.

CSV Format

Expected CSV format with OHLC columns: 

csvdate,open,high,low,close,volume
2024-01-01,42000.0,42467.87,41724.29,42179.38,37561.9
2024-01-02,42179.38,42518.55,41964.56,42344.94,29852.4
EOF)

Bash(/Users/ufvg/tradeanim/docs/index.html << 'EOF'

# Elements

Elements are the visual primitives drawn on the chart. All elements inherit from the base Element class with common properties: opacity \(float, 0-1\), visible \(bool\), z_order \(int\).

CandleElement

A single candlestick. Created automatically by Chart you rarely create these directly.

Parameter Type Default Description
index int 0 Candle position on x-axis
timestamp str "" Date/time label
open float 0.0 Open price
high float 0.0 High price
low float 0.0 Low price
close float 0.0 Close price
volume float 0.0 Trading volume
bull_color Optional[str] None Override color for bullish candles \(None = use theme\)
bear_color Optional[str] None Override color for bearish candles
scale_y float 1.0 Vertical scale \(used by CandleGrow animation\)
offset_y float 0.0 Vertical offset \(used by Shake animation\)
glow_enabled bool False Enable glow effect around candle
glow_radius float 3.0 Glow spread radius
glow_intensity float 0.15 Glow brightness

Properties: is_bull \(close >= open\), body_top, body_bottom, body_height, mid 

python# Enable glow on specific candles
for candle in chart.candles[:10]:
    candle.glow_enabled = True
    candle.glow_intensity = 0.3

LineElement

A line or curve drawn on the chart. Used by indicators \(SMA, EMA, etc\).

Parameter Type Default Description
points_x list [] X coordinates
points_y list [] Y coordinates
color str "#2196F3" Line color
linewidth float 1.5 Line thickness
linestyle str "-" Style: "-", "--", "-.", ":"
draw_progress float 1.0 How much of the line is visible \(0-1, animated by DrawLine\)
label str "" Label shown at line end 
pythonline = LineElement\(
    points_x=[0, 10, 20, 30],
    points_y=[100, 105, 98, 110],
    color="#FF9800",
    linewidth=2,
    linestyle="--",
\)
self.add_element\(line\)
self.play\(DrawLine\(line\), duration=2\)

AreaElement

A line with gradient fill down to a baseline. Accepts all LineElement parameters plus the following:

Parameter Type Default Description
fill_color str "#2196F3" Fill gradient color
fill_alpha_top float 0.4 Opacity at the line
fill_alpha_bottom float 0.0 Opacity at the baseline
baseline Optional[float] None Fill baseline \(None = axis bottom\)
draw_progress float 1.0 Animated by ChartAppear

TextElement

Text displayed on the chart. Usually created via text helper functions.

Parameter Type Default Description
text str "" The text content
x float 0.0 X position
y float 0.0 Y position
color str "#d1d4dc" Text color
font_size float 14.0 Font size in points
font_weight str "normal" "normal" or "bold"
font_family str "monospace" Font family
ha str "left" Horizontal alignment: "left", "center", "right"
va str "bottom" Vertical alignment: "bottom", "center", "top"
bbox Optional[dict] None Background box \(matplotlib bbox dict\)
rotation float 0.0 Rotation in degrees
char_progress float 1.0 Fraction of text visible \(animated by TypeText\)
use_data_coords bool True True=chart coordinates, False=screen fraction \(0-1\)
font_path Optional[str] None Path to custom .ttf/.otf font file
font_style str "normal" "normal" or "italic"
text_shadow Optional[dict] None Drop shadow: {"color": "#000", "offset_x": 2, "offset_y": -2, "alpha": 0.5}
text_outline Optional[dict] None Text outline: {"color": "#000", "width": 3}
scale float 1.0 Scale factor \(animated by ScaleIn/BounceIn\)

ZoneElement

A rectangular highlighted zone/region.

Parameter Type Default Description
x1 float 0.0 Left horizontal bound \(candle index\)
x2 float 0.0 Right horizontal bound \(candle index\)
y1 float 0.0 Bottom vertical bound \(price level\)
y2 float 0.0 Top vertical bound \(price level\)
fill_color str "#2196F340" Fill color with alpha
border_color Optional[str] None Border color \(None = no border\)
border_width float 1.0 Border line width
border_style str "-" Border style: "-", "--", ":"
label str "" Label text inside zone
label_color str "#d1d4dc" Label text color
label_size float 10.0 Label font size
hatch Optional[str] None Matplotlib hatch pattern \("//", "\\\\", "xx", "..", etc\)
extend_right bool False Extend zone to right edge of viewport 
pythonzone = ZoneElement\(
    x1=10, x2=20, y1=42000, y2=43000,
    fill_color="#26a69a30",
    border_color="#26a69a",
    label="Demand Zone",
\)
self.play\(HighlightZone\(zone\), duration=0.8\)

HLineElement

A horizontal line spanning the chart.

Parameter Type Default Description
y float 0.0 Price level
color str "#787b86" Line color
linewidth float 1.0 Thickness
linestyle str "--" Style
label str "" Label at right end
label_color Optional[str] None Label color \(None = use line color\)
label_size float 10.0 Label font size
x_start Optional[float] None Left bound \(None = viewport left\)
x_end Optional[float] None Right bound \(None = viewport right\)

ArrowElement

An arrow annotation pointing between two coordinates.

Parameter Type Default Description
x1 float 0.0 Arrow tail X position
y1 float 0.0 Arrow tail Y position
x2 float 0.0 Arrow head X position
y2 float 0.0 Arrow head Y position
color str "#d1d4dc" Arrow color
linewidth float 1.5 Shaft thickness
head_width float 0.3 Arrowhead width
head_length float 0.2 Arrowhead length
label str "" Label text near arrow
label_color Optional[str] None Label color
label_size float 10.0 Label font size 
pythonarrow = ArrowElement\(
    x1=25, y1=41000,
    x2=25, y2=41800,
    color="#26a69a",
    label="Buy Signal",
\)
self.play\(FadeIn\(arrow\), duration=0.5\)

FillBetweenElement

A filled area between two y-curves \(used by Bollinger Bands fill\).

Parameter Type Default Description
points_x list [] Shared X coordinates
upper_y list [] Upper boundary Y values
lower_y list [] Lower boundary Y values
fill_color str "#2196F315" Fill color with alpha
edge_color Optional[str] None Edge line color
edge_width float 0.5 Edge line width
draw_progress float 1.0 Fraction visible
label str "" Label text
EOF)

Bash(/Users/ufvg/tradeanim/docs/index.html << 'EOF'

# Animations

tradeanim includes 23 built-in animations. All accept a duration and optional easing parameter.

Candle Animations

CandlesAppear

Make candles appear on the chart with various animation styles. 

pythonCandlesAppear\(chart, start=0, end=None, style="sequential", auto_camera=True, duration=3.0, easing=None\)
Style Description
"sequential" Candles appear one by one, left to right \(default\)
"all" / "fade" All candles fade in simultaneously
"slide_up" Candles slide up from below the chart
"pop" Candles pop in with overshoot \(uses ease_out_back\)
"cascade" Staggered timing with 60% overlap between candles 
python# Show candles with different styles
self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart, style="pop"\), duration=3\)

# Reveal only a subset of candles
self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart, start=0, end=30\), duration=2\)

AddCandles

Append additional candles to an already-visible chart. 

pythonAddCandles\(chart, start=0, end=None, auto_camera=True, duration=2.0, easing=None\)
python# Show first 40, then add the rest
self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart, end=40\), duration=3\)
self.play\(AddCandles\(chart, start=40\), duration=2\)

Fade & Visibility

FadeIn

pythonFadeIn\(*elements, duration=0.5, easing=None\)

Fades in one or more elements. Automatically adds them to the scene.

FadeOut

pythonFadeOut\(*elements, remove=False, duration=0.5, easing=None\)

Fades out elements. If remove=True, removes them from the scene after fading. 

pythonself.play\(FadeIn\(title, subtitle\), duration=0.5\)
self.wait\(2\)
self.play\(FadeOut\(title, subtitle, remove=True\), duration=0.5\)

Drawing Animations

DrawLine

pythonDrawLine\(line, duration=2.0, easing=None\)  # default easing: ease_in_out_cubic

Progressively draws a line from start to end.

TypeText

pythonTypeText\(text, duration=1.0, easing=None\)  # default easing: linear

Typewriter-style text reveal, one character at a time.

HighlightZone

pythonHighlightZone\(zone, duration=0.8, easing=None\)

Fades in a rectangular zone highlight.

Camera Animations

PanCamera

pythonPanCamera\(view_start, view_end, price_min=None, price_max=None, duration=1.5, easing=None\)

Default easing: ease_in_out_cubic. Smoothly pans the camera to a new viewport. If price_min/price_max are None, keeps current values.

ZoomTo

pythonZoomTo\(chart, start_idx, end_idx, padding=0.1, duration=1.5, easing=None\)

Default easing: ease_in_out_cubic. Zooms to show a specific range of candles. 

python# Zoom into candles 20-40
self.play\(ZoomTo\(chart, 20, 40\), duration=1.5\)
self.wait\(1\)
# Pan back to full view
self.play\(PanCamera\(view_start=-1, view_end=len\(chart\) + 3\), duration=1.2\)

Entrance Animations

SlideIn

pythonSlideIn\(element, direction="left", distance=0.15, duration=0.6, easing=None\)

Slides element in from a direction with simultaneous fade. Directions: "left", "right", "up", "down".

SlideOut

pythonSlideOut\(element, direction="right", distance=0.15, duration=0.5, easing=None\)

Slides element out with fade. Sets visible=False on finish.

ScaleIn

pythonScaleIn\(text, duration=0.5, easing=None\)  # default easing: ease_out_back

Scales text from 0 to 1 with overshoot effect. Works on TextElement.

BounceIn

pythonBounceIn\(text, duration=0.7, easing=None\)  # default easing: ease_out_bounce

Scales text from 0 to 1 with bounce effect.

Wipe

pythonWipe\(*elements, direction="left", duration=1.0, easing=None\)

Directional reveal of elements. Sorts by position based on direction.

Sweep

pythonSweep\(*elements, duration=1.5, easing=None\)  # default: ease_in_out_cubic

Left-to-right curtain reveal. Sorts elements by x-position.

StaggeredFadeIn

pythonStaggeredFadeIn\(*elements, stagger=0.08, duration=0.5, easing=None\)

Cascading fade-in with per-element delay. Total duration = duration + stagger * \(n-1\).

CandleGrow

pythonCandleGrow\(*candles, sequential=True, auto_camera=True, duration=1.0, easing=None\)

Candles grow from zero body height to full. If sequential=True, candles grow one after another.

ChartAppear

pythonChartAppear\(chart, auto_camera=True, duration=3.0, easing=None\)

Generic appearance for any chart type \(line, area, ohlc\). Animates opacity and draw_progress.

Effect Animations

FlashCandle

pythonFlashCandle\(candle, flash_color="#FFD54F", cycles=3, duration=1.0\)

Sinusoidal color flash on a single candle. Restores original colors on finish.

GlowPulse

pythonGlowPulse\(element, min_opacity=0.3, max_opacity=1.0, cycles=3, duration=2.0\)

Oscillates opacity sinusoidally between min and max.

Pulse

pythonPulse\(element, min_opacity=0.4, cycles=2, duration=1.5\)

Rhythmic opacity pulsing from min_opacity to 1.0.

ColorShift

pythonColorShift\(element, attr="color", start_color="#ffffff", end_color="#ff0000", duration=1.0, easing=None\)

Smoothly transitions any color attribute via RGB interpolation.

Shake

pythonShake\(element, amplitude=0.5, frequency=15.0, duration=0.5, easing=None\)

Decaying sinusoidal jitter on offset_y. Resets to 0 on finish.

MorphLine

pythonMorphLine\(line, target_y, duration=1.0, easing=None\)  # default: ease_in_out_cubic

Interpolates a line's y-values to a new shape. 

pythonsma = SMA\(chart, 20\)
self.play\(DrawLine\(sma\), duration=2\)
# Morph SMA into EMA shape
ema = EMA\(chart, 10\)
self.play\(MorphLine\(sma, target_y=ema.points_y\), duration=1.5\)

Post-Processing Animation

AnimatePostProcess

pythonAnimatePostProcess\(pp_config, duration=2.0, easing=None, **field_ranges\)

Smoothly interpolates PostProcessConfig attributes. Each kwarg is \(start_value, end_value\). 

pythonpp = self.config.post_processing

# Ramp chromatic aberration from 0 to 10 pixels
self.play\(AnimatePostProcess\(pp, chromatic_aberration_offset=\(0.0, 10.0\)\), duration=2\)
# Ramp back
self.play\(AnimatePostProcess\(pp, chromatic_aberration_offset=\(10.0, 0.0\)\), duration=1.5\)

# Multiple effects at once
self.play\(AnimatePostProcess\(pp,
    bloom_intensity=\(0.0, 0.3\),
    vignette_strength=\(0.0, 0.5\),
    chromatic_aberration_offset=\(0.0, 5.0\),
\), duration=2\)
EOF)

Bash(/Users/ufvg/tradeanim/docs/index.html << 'EOF'

# Easing Functions

16 easing functions that control animation acceleration/deceleration. All take a float t \(0 to 1\) and return a float. Import from tradeanim.easing. 

pythonfrom tradeanim.easing import ease_out_cubic, ease_in_out_sine, ease_out_bounce
Function Description Best For
linear No easing, constant speed Continuous motion, TypeText
ease_in_quad Quadratic acceleration Subtle speed-up starts
ease_out_quad Quadratic deceleration Gentle stops
ease_in_out_quad Quad accel then decel Smooth transitions
ease_in_cubic Cubic acceleration Dramatic speed-up starts
ease_out_cubic Cubic deceleration \(DEFAULT\) Most animations, natural feel
ease_in_out_cubic Cubic accel then decel Camera movements, DrawLine
ease_in_sine Sine wave acceleration Gentle starts
ease_out_sine Sine wave deceleration Gentle stops
ease_in_out_sine Sine wave both Smooth camera pans
ease_in_expo Exponential acceleration Explosive starts
ease_out_expo Exponential deceleration Dramatic stops
ease_in_out_expo Exponential both Strong emphasis transitions
ease_out_back Decel with overshoot ScaleIn, “pop” effects
ease_out_elastic Elastic spring Bouncy, playful animations
ease_out_bounce Multi-bounce BounceIn, landing effects 
pythonfrom tradeanim.easing import ease_out_bounce, ease_in_out_sine

# Apply to any animation
self.play\(FadeIn\(title, easing=ease_out_bounce\), duration=1.0\)
self.play\(PanCamera\(0, 50, easing=ease_in_out_sine\), duration=1.5\)
self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart, easing=ease_out_back\), duration=3\)
Tip: The default easing \(ease_out_cubic\) works well for most animations. Use ease_in_out_cubic or ease_in_out_sine for camera movements. Use ease_out_back for entrance animations like ScaleIn.

# Camera Controls

Camera controls let you pan and zoom the viewport to focus on different parts of the chart.

PanCamera

Smoothly interpolate the camera to a new viewport position.

pythonPanCamera\(view_start, view_end, price_min=None, price_max=None, duration=1.5, easing=None\)
  • view_start / view_end — Target candle index range
  • price_min / price_max — Target price range \(None = keep current\)
  • Default easing: ease_in_out_cubic
python# Pan to show candles 20-50
self.play\(PanCamera\(view_start=20, view_end=50\), duration=1.5\)

# Pan with specific price range
self.play\(PanCamera\(
    view_start=0, view_end=80,
    price_min=41000, price_max=45000,
    easing=ease_in_out_sine,
\), duration=1.5\)

ZoomTo

Zoom to show a specific range of candles with automatic price fitting.

pythonZoomTo\(chart, start_idx, end_idx, padding=0.1, duration=1.5, easing=None\)
  • Automatically computes price_min / price_max from the candle range
  • padding — Extra space around candles as fraction of price range
python# Zoom into candles 20-40
self.play\(ZoomTo\(chart, 20, 40, padding=0.1\), duration=1.5\)
self.wait\(2\)

# Zoom back to full chart
self.play\(PanCamera\(
    view_start=-1, view_end=len\(chart\) + 3,
    price_min=min\(c.low for c in chart.candles\) * 0.99,
    price_max=max\(c.high for c in chart.candles\) * 1.01,
\), duration=1.2\)

Camera.fit_to_candles

Manually fit the camera to a set of candles \(no animation\).

pythonself.camera.fit_to_candles\(chart.candles, padding_top=0.05, padding_bottom=0.05, padding_right=3\)
Note: CandlesAppear and ZoomTo call fit_to_candles automatically when auto_camera=True \(default\). Use it manually when you need to snap the camera without animation.

Camera-Driven Storytelling

pythonclass CameraDemo\(Scene\):
    def construct\(self\):
        chart = self.load_chart\("data.csv"\)
        n = len\(chart\)

        # Act 1: Reveal all candles
        self.play\(CandlesAppear\(chart\), duration=4\)
        self.wait\(0.5\)

        # Act 2: Zoom into area of interest
        self.play\(ZoomTo\(chart, 20, 45, padding=0.08\), duration=1.5\)

        # Add indicators on zoomed view
        sma = SMA\(chart, 20\)
        self.play\(DrawLine\(sma\), duration=2\)
        self.wait\(1\)

        # Act 3: Pan to later section
        self.play\(PanCamera\(view_start=40, view_end=n + 3\), duration=1.2\)
        self.wait\(1\)

        # Act 4: Zoom back to full chart
        hi = max\(c.high for c in chart.candles\)
        lo = min\(c.low for c in chart.candles\)
        rng = hi - lo
        self.play\(PanCamera\(
            view_start=-1, view_end=n + 3,
            price_min=lo - rng * 0.05,
            price_max=hi + rng * 0.05,
        \), duration=1.2\)
        self.wait\(2\)
EOF)
